title: Europe markets close 1.3% lower after U.S. data, Bank of England cut; banks tumble 4.5%
content: European markets closed lower on Thursday as investors processed a raft of central bank action and fresh U.S. economic data.
summary: European markets closed lower on Thursday as investors processed a raft of central bank action and fresh U.S. economic data.

title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Can India's hot deal-making season extend to a free trade agreement?
content: India and the U.K. are motivated and see each other benefiting from a deal — but a number of key demands from both stand in the way of a quick agreement.
summary: India and the U.K. are motivated and see each other benefiting from a deal — but a number of key demands from both stand in the way of a quick agreement.

title: Putin's Trader: How Russian hackers stole millions from U.S. investors
content: This CNBC documentary is about the rise and fall of Vladislav Klyushin and his business empire. Klyushin was just released from a U.S. prison in a prisoner swap.
summary: This CNBC documentary is about the rise and fall of Vladislav Klyushin and his business empire. Klyushin was just released from a U.S. prison in a prisoner swap.

title: WSJ reporter Evan Gershkovich, ex-Marine Whelan released in U.S., Russia prisoner swap
content: The swap of American, Russian and German prisoners is the largest such exchange since the Cold War.

title: 10-year Treasury yield falls below 4% for the first time since February
content: Treasury yields were steady as investors digested comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, who suggested a September rate cut was on the table.
summary: Treasury yields were steady as investors digested comments from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, who suggested a September rate cut was on the table.

title: Amazon to report quarterly earnings after the close
content: Analysts expect Amazon to show revenue growth of 10.5% in its second-quarter earnings report.
summary: Analysts expect Amazon to show revenue growth of 10.5% in its second-quarter earnings report.

title: Apple set to report fiscal third-quarter earnings after the bell
content: This year, the "main event" won't be Apple's earnings, it's what Apple says about the September quarter.
summary: This year, the "main event" won't be Apple's earnings, it's what Apple says about the September quarter.

title: I’ve been to 100 countries. I didn't expect to want to return to these 5
content: Travel enthusiast Todd Miller identifies the five countries that he had assumed would be "one and done" places, but that left him wanting to know much more.
summary: Travel enthusiast Todd Miller identifies the five countries that he had assumed would be "one and done" places, but that left him wanting to know much more.

title: Here's how much athletes at the Paris Olympics earn for winning medals
content: Aside from a medal, a stuffed toy of the Olympics mascot and an official event poster, some medal winners are accorded additional financial rewards.

title: Israeli military says it killed Hamas armed wing leader Mohammed Deif in Gaza airstrike last month
content: Israel's military on Thursday said it killed the chief of Hamas' military wing, Mohammed Deif, in an airstrike in July.

title: Wayfair CEO likens home goods slowdown to 2008 financial crisis
content: Online home goods company Wayfair has seen sluggish demand against high interest rates, but reprieve could come if the federal reserve cuts rates in September.
summary: Online home goods company Wayfair has seen sluggish demand against high interest rates, but reprieve could come if the federal reserve cuts rates in September.

title: Moderna stock falls 20% as it slashes guidance on low EU sales, tough U.S. vaccine market
content: Moderna now expects 2024 product revenue to come in between $3 billion and $3.5 billion, down from a previous guidance of $4 billion.
summary: Moderna now expects 2024 product revenue to come in between $3 billion and $3.5 billion, down from a previous guidance of $4 billion.

title: Rolls-Royce shares soar to all-time high on reinstated dividend, raised profit guidance

title: Barclays profit dips in the second quarter, beats estimates
content: The British lender is undergoing a major restructuring program in a bid to boost profits.

title: Shell beats second-quarter profit expectations, launches $3.5 billion share buyback program
content: Shell on Thursday posted stronger-than-expected second-quarter profit after issuing a warning over lower fossil fuel prices and refining margins.
summary: Shell on Thursday posted stronger-than-expected second-quarter profit after issuing a warning over lower fossil fuel prices and refining margins.

title: World’s first major AI law enters into force — here's what it means for U.S. tech giants

title: Meta's advertising growth is proof that hefty AI spending is already paying off

title: 'Internal battle' in Modi's BJP on whether India needs Chinese investments, Natixis chief Asia economist says

title: Japan confirms $36.8 billion currency intervention as weak yen pushes BOJ to hike interest rates
content: Japanese authorities spent 5.53 trillion yen, or $36.8 billion, to shore up the yen in July, official data published Wednesday showed.
summary: Japanese authorities spent 5.53 trillion yen, or $36.8 billion, to shore up the yen in July, official data published Wednesday showed.

title: Asia markets mixed after Powell signals rate cut; Japan stocks tumble as yen strengthens

summary: At his press conference, Fed Chair Jerome Powell said a rate cut in September is “on the table,” provided the inflation data continues to be encouraging.

title: More people are exploring alcohol-free trips and 'sober curious' vacations
